Roko pogrešanega turista našli v morskem psu?
Na njej je bil poročni prstan.
07 Nov 2019, 19:16 by T. V.
V vodah francoskega otoka Reunion, ki se nahaja v Indijskem oceanu približno 800 kilometrov vzhodno od Madagaskarja, so ubili nevarnega morskega psa, ki je ogrožal turiste. Sodeč po najdbi v drobovju velike morske zveri, pa je bilo za enega turista že prepozno.Znotraj morskega psa so našli človeško roko, na njej pa poročni prstan. Oblasti so prepričane, da je to roka škotskega turista (44), ki je prejšnji teden izginil med dopustovanjem na Reunionu, kamor je prišel z ženo. Za Škotom je izginila vsaka sled, ko je šel sam plavat in se ni vrnil. Njegova žena je zagnala alarm, stekla je iskalna akcija. Na delu so bili tudi potapljači, ladje in helikopter, na kopnem pa sledni psi, a Škota niso našli.Vse do zdaj. Ali gre res za posmrtne ostanke nesrečnega Škota, bo pokazala analiza DNK. Morskega psa so skupaj s še štirimi ribami ubili, ker so se preveč približevali plažam s turisti. Za zdaj ni znano, ali je več kot tri metre dolg morski pes Škota (če gre res zanj) napadel ali pa je ta utonil in se je morski pes lotil njegovega trupla. Če je šlo za napad, je bil to že 24. napad morskih psov v vodah okoli Reuniona od leta 2011 do danes. Kar 11 izmed teh napadov se je končalo usodno za ljudi.
text:
A missing tourist's hand found in a shark?
There was a wedding ring on it.
07 Nov 2019, 19:16 by T.V.
The waters of the French island of Reunion, located in the Indian Ocean about 800 kilometers east of Madagascar, killed a dangerous shark that threatened tourists. According to the find in the shallows of a large shark, it was too late for one tourist. A human hand was found inside the shark and a wedding ring was found on it. Authorities believe this is the hand of a Scottish tourist, 44, who disappeared last week while on vacation in Reunion, where he and his wife arrived. Behind the Scots, every trace disappeared when he went swimming alone and did not return. His wife started the alarm, a search action was launched. There were also divers, ships and a helicopter at work, followed by dogs on the land but not found by Scot. Whether it is the remains of the unfortunate Scot, DNA analysis will show. The shark, along with four other fish, were killed because they were getting too close to beaches with tourists. It is unknown at this time whether the shark, if more than three meters long (if it really comes to him), attacked or drowned and the shark tackled its corpse. If it was an attack, it was the 24th shark attack in the waters around Reunion from 2011 to the present. As many as 11 of these attacks ended fatal to humans.
